title: The most expensive failed celebrity marriages of all time
text: £493 ALI LANDRY AND MARIO LOPEZ: £8,571 PER DAY Actor Mario Lopez's six year relationship with model and actress Ali Landry ended in an annulment after two weeks of marriage when photos emerged of him with another woman at his bachelor party. Mario later admitted: 'I got inebriated and a little too friendly with a young lady.' 'At that point I was not ready to settle down. 'I wasn't man enough to know how to go about handling it.' Actor Mario Lopez's marriage to model Ali Landry ended after 14 days, when photos emerged of him cheating with another woman at his bachelor party CHRIS KATTAN AND SUNSHINE TUTT: £8,474 PER DAY Comedian Chris who is best known not just for his 10 years on Saturday Night Live married model Sunshine Deia Tutt in 2008. He proposed at her grandparents’ home in Gainesville, Texas after three years of dating and the pair married in the Yosemite Valley, California. The pair stayed married for just two months after allegations of infidelity on Tutt's side emerged and she Tutt walked away with a settlement in the low six figures. Comedian Chris Kattan and model Sunshine Tutt were married for just two months PAMELA ANDERSON AND RICK SALOMON: £752.90 PER DAY The former Baywatch star announced her engagement to producer Rick on the Ellen show in September 2007. They married two months later in a small wedding ceremony at The Mirage in Las Vegas, between the actress' nightly appearances in Hans Klok's magic show at Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino. Two months after that they were separated and the actress requested an annulment in early 2008. However, she dropped a bombshell - again on the Ellen Show - in 2013, announcing that the pair were still having a sexual relationship, as friends with benefits. A year later she announced they had remarried but by the following year they were divorced for a second time. Pamela Anderson with her third husband, music producer Rick Salomon. Their first marriage lasted 170 days and the pair later remarried only to divorce for a second time PAMELA ANDERSON AND KID ROCK: £440 PER DAY The former Baywatch star and the tattooed rapper married in on a yacht in Saint-Tropez Stars such as Elton John and Tamara Mellon attended the nuptials and the bride wore a white string bikini. The wedding occurred within weeks of the former couple rekindle their relationship after running into each other in St Tropez, but it ended just four months later. Pamela Anderson wed Kid Rock on a yacht in St Tropez in 2006, but the union ended in divorce just four months later ETHEL MERMAN AND ERNEST BORGNINE Actor Ernest Borgnine married Ethel Merman, the gravel-voiced comedy queen of Broadway, best known for her role in Gypsy in 1964. Their Hollywood wedding was celebrated in the back garden of Borgnine’s home the minute he was free from High Noon star Katy Jurado, his third wife. The occasion was topped off with 50 white doves, £4,000 worth of flowers and 38 violinists playing romantic music. The couple then left for a honeymoon cruise in the Far East. Less than six weeks later, it was all over as on their return, Ethel was spotted coming out of their house with a bruised cheek. She told her friend, comedy star Lucille Ball: ‘Ernie has the most terrible temper. When he’s mad, he smashes everything in sight. I can’t live like that.’ Actor Ernest Borgnine and Broadway star Ethel Merman had split up within two months of their 1964 wedding BRITNEY SPEARS AND JASON ALEXANDER: £335 PER DAY Britney and Jason's short-lived 2004 marriage went down as one of the shortest showbusiness marriages in history. Only hours after Britney, then 22, exchanged vows with childhood friend Alexander at a Las Vegas wedding chapel, she was said to have changed her mind and signed an annulment. At the time there was speculation that the whirlwind marriage might have been the culmination of a drunken weekend that got out of hand, or - more cynically - that it could all have been a publicity stunt. Luckily it was one of the least costly on the list as the wedding only set the pair back £670. Britney and Jason's short-lived 2004 marriage went down as one of the shortest showbusiness marriages in history NICKY HILTON AND TODD ANDREW MEISTER: £493 PER DAY Nicky and and Meister, a Harvard graduate money manager had met when she was 15 and were dating on and off from 2003. A year later, the pair said 'I do' in a Las Vegas chapel after what had been a girls weekend partying at the Palm with Tara Reid, Nicole Richie, Bijou Phillips, and then-couple Lindsay Lohan and Wilmer Valderrama. Hilton, who wore a thigh skimming aqua blue halterneck dress and a crystal accentuated wedding veil, and her blue jeans-wearing groom were joined by elder sister Paris, then 23, who wore a pink dress to serve as her bridesmaid. The union was annulled just six weeks later.
